Posts.Content: babygose1 wrote: Without opting for reconstructive surgery, my adopted mom had a double mastectomy a year ago. She has several variations of prosthetics that she wears, and says they aren't comfortable. "Heavy, unwashable, they hurt her scars, don't look real, etc." I was wondering if other people who've had mastectomies experience the same things, and what would you do to make it better if you made them? I am an art student and want to surprise her with a pair that I made myself. Any advice or input would be greatly appreciated! Stay strong! Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: What could be better about your prosthetic? babygose1 crystalphm

Posts.Content: Apr 17, 2015 11:57AM babygose1 wrote: Thanks Erica! I will check it out! It's been a long process.
Posts.Title: What could be better about your prosthetic? babygose1 crystalphm

Posts.Content: Apr 17, 2015 11:56AM babygose1 wrote: Thank you wrenn! I really appreciate the feedback. I know she's very self-conscious still, and even though I think she's beautiful, I know it will mean a lot to her. Maybe if the one I make is fantastic, I'll make more! :D
